description: dys- +‎ -genic, produced from New Latin dys- from  Ancient Greek δυσ- (dus-, “bad”) and γένος (génos, “offspring”).

adjectives.description: dysgenic (comparative more dysgenic, superlative most dysgenic)

entries.meaning: (genetics, medicine) of or relating to, or causing degeneration or deterioration in offspring
(genetics, medicine) of or relating to dysgenics
